column4: Good Evening from Germany! Today I booted into my ubuntu partition and Ubuntu updated Grub. Now when I boot, my encrypted Debian partition is gone. Well, its still there, but when I boot it, it doesnt ask for a password to decrypt the encrypted partition but instead initialises the debian on the boot partition itself. Did I describe that in an understandable way? I wonder how to get back my encrypted debian system now.
du kanst nicht auf die partition zugreifen oder nicht das OS davon booten?
well, obviously on the partition that my encrypted debian partition uses as /boot there also is a whole debian installation. And that one boots now.
okay sorry i cant help you there :D i have not so much experience with encrypted devices...
